name: AsyncBridge
body:
### What does it do?
AsyncBridge lets you use the VS 11 C#5 compiler to write code that uses the async and await keywords, but to target .NET 4.0. It was published by Daniel Grunwald (from SharpDevelop) [here](https://gist.github.com/1961087).

As an extra, I've thrown in the new C#5 [caller info attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh534540.aspx), which lets you automatically add the method name, line number or file path to your code.

### Authors and Contributors
* _**Daniel Grunwald**_ (@dgrunwald) - Original [code](https://gist.github.com/1961087).
* _**Omer Mor**_ (@OmerMor) - Turned it into a full blown [github repo](https://github.com/OmerMor/AsyncBridge) with the complimentary [nuget](http://nuget.org/packages/AsyncBridge).
* _**Alex Davies**_ (@alexdavies74) - Wrote the [blog post](http://www.simple-talk.com/community/blogs/alex/archive/2012/04/08/107197.aspx) that inspired this, and is actively improving the code.
tagline: Adds the new C#5 async features for .NET 4 projects
